communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Maryland Heights PD FOIA Logs 2021, 2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Your agency's Freedom of Information Request logs for calendar years of 2021 and 2022. These logs should include a request date, description of records requested, requester organization (if applicable) and current status of the requests.

Further, I request that this document be sent in any digital formats in which it exists (such as PDF and Excel). Under the terms of the E-FOIA Amendments of 1996, Section 5, if a document exists in electronic format, it must be released in that format upon request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Hawkins

communications.subject: Request for Public Records - Acknowledgement
communications.communication:
Kevin,

This e-mail servers to acknowledge we have received your request for public records.  As the information spans two years and involves a combined total of over 650 requests, the City will require time to compile the information.

I will be in contact with you regarding status by close of business on Friday, August 18th.

Thanks.


Emery L. Ransom
Deputy City Clerk
City of Maryland Heights
11911 Dorsett Road
Maryland Heights, MO  63043

Fax:  (314) 738-2413

communications.subject: RE: Request for Public Records - Acknowledgement
communications.communication:
Kevin,

I have attached the information you requested to this e-mail in the form of a PDF as well as attached Excel spreadsheets, one for 2021 and another for 2022.

In the interests of providing your data in a more expedient timeframe, as well as reducing the cost of staff research that we would have to pass along, I have provided the summary details of each request we logged;  Name (which gives basic details as to what is being requested), Date Requested and Status.

To include the requestor's information for each would require us modify the report and manually compile the data from each record, which would take a considerable amount of time.

Let me know if this report I have attached suffices to fulfill your request.

Thanks.


Emery L. Ransom

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Tennessee Open Records Law - Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.	A list of ALL types of alternative asset investments, including private equity, venture capital, distressed debt, mezzanine, fund of funds, infrastructure, natural resources, real estate and private debt partnerships in which Knoxville City Pension Board is an investor; and
2.	For each partnership, may I please have a copy of any alternative assets investment records that would show some or all of the following information:

a.	Knoxville City Pension Board's total commitment to the partnership,
b.	the total contributions made by Knoxville City Pension Board to the partnership to date,
c.	the total distributions received by Knoxville City Pension Board from the partnership to date,
d.	the estimated current value of Knoxville City Pension Board's holding in the partnership, and
e.	any available estimates of the Net and Gross IRR earned by Knoxville City Pension Board to date on its investment in the partnership.

3.	In addition to this could you please provide me with an up to date account of your current asset allocations in the above asset classes including any direct investments you may have.

Thank you very much for your attention to this request. In the event that Knoxville City Pension Board has no such investments, a simple note to this effect will suffice.  We understand that we may be charged for the cost of the copies requested, and agree to pay these charges. 

Thank you again for your attention to this request. 

Yours faithfully,

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Open Records Reques: Grant
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

On March 24, 2023, the State of New Jersey Office of the Attorney General issued a press release stating: "AG Platkin Announces 20 NJ Law Enforcement Agencies to Receive Grants Totaling $7 Million for Technology to Combat Gun Violence." The Bergen County Sheriff's Office is listed as a recipient of a $336,500 grant. (https://www.njoag.gov/ag-platkin-announces-20-nj-law-enforcement-agencies-to-receive-grants-totaling-7-million-for-technology-to-combat-gun-violence/)

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents for the Bergen County Sheriff's $336,500 grant awarded by the Office of Attorney General, Department of Law and Public Safety and described in the press release linked above.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (January 2023) (Everett Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

You had previously indicated that it would be completed on Sept. 24, 2021. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date.  You had assigned it reference number #D004313-081221.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of August 12, 2021, Reference # D004313-081221 
Dear Phil Mocek, 
The Everett Police Department received a public records request from you on August 12, 2021. You requested the following: 
"To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: OpenDocument spreadsheet, plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Phil Mocek

title: List of all Department of Interior owned unmanned aircraft systems

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: List of all Department of Interior owned unmanned aircraft systems
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all unmanned aircraft systems, sometimes known as drones, owned by the department. I ask that the make, model, year and unique identifier of each craft be includes, as well as any other data tracked by your agency. 

I have reason to believe the department's Office of Aviation Services manages its fleet of unmanned aircraft systems. That is spelled out by the document "DOI OPERATIONAL PROCEDURES MEMORANDUM (OPM) - 11", You can see the document here: https://www.doi.gov/sites/doi.gov/files/opm-11.pdf You may wish to forward this request to their office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: DOI-OS-2023-001109 Acknowledgement Letter
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Welsh: 
The Office of the Secretary (OS) FOIA Office received two FOIA requests, dated November 30, 2022, on November 30, 2022 and assigned them control numbers DOI-OS-2023-001109 and 2023-001110, respectively. We aggregated DOI-OS-2023-001110 into DOI-OS-2023-001109. Therefore, we will be closing DOI-OS-2023-001110. Please cite DOI-OS-2023-001109 in any future communications with our office regarding your request. 

You requested the following records: 
“A list of all unmanned aircraft systems, sometimes known as drones, owned by the department. I ask that the make, model, year and unique identifier of each craft be includes (sic), as well as any other data tracked by your agency. 
The full list of flights recorded in the department's ‘OAS-2U UAS Flight Use Reporting Form.’ 
I request that a database dump with all available columns be released." 
Please refer to the attached acknowledgement letter. 
Yours, 
Tracy Jolivette

communications.subject: FOIA Request DOI-OS-2023-001109
communications.communication:
Good morning Mr. Welsh,

I am writing to you regarding the scope of your request. I have completed my review of DOI-OS-2023-001109. The responsive records consist of excel documents, some of which contain columns of PII (personally identifiable information). Because the PII columns contain some names and email addresses belonging to law enforcement officials, they must be redacted and sent to the Solicitor's office for further review, which could significantly increase the wait time for these records.

However, if you are amenable to excluding the columns with PII from the responsive records, we could then release them to you immediately. The make, model, year, and identifiers of each drone would still be available in the responsive records. Would you be willing to exclude the columns of PII? Please let me know at your convenience so that I can move to either release the records (should you agree to remove columns with PII) or send the records for further review (if you wish to keep the columns with PII).

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D92BE6.FABDDE80]
Tim Turner
Government Information Specialist
U.S. Department of the Interior
Office of the Secretary

files.title: image001
files.source: Department of the Interior, United States of America

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Lake Washington School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2015 - 2021
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the Lake Washington School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

In the event the District chooses to provide these records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

I request electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record. 

I request for these public records to be produced by public (no password) e-mail attachment or link. If electronic attachment or link is not possible, an alternative would be to produce responsive records via USB DRIVE or DATA CD-ROM.

THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING MADE FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PRA Audit

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Lake Washington School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2015 - 2021
communications.communication:
Hello,

On November 11, 2021 Mason Effertz, Records Manager, Lake Washington School District sent a letter regarding our 11-05-2021 Public records Request stating the following:

"At this time, due to the amount of information in the request, the District estimates that it will be able to produce these documents by July 15, 2022."

A copy of Mr. Effertz letter is attached. 


On 3-15-22 We requested confirmation from the District that ALL RESPONSIVE RECORDS for this public records request would be received on or before July 15, 2022. 

We received no response to our email.

On 04-01-22 We requested confirmation from the District that ALL RESPONSIVE RECORDS for this public records request would be received on or before July 15, 2022. 

We received no response to our email.

Today is July 16, 2022. It has been 253 days since the original 11-05-2021 public records request and the District has not produced a single record or responded to a single communication.

This delay in records production is unreasonable and a violation of RCW 42.56.

Please provide ALL RESPONSIVE RECORDS for this public records request IMMEDIATELY without any further delay.

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Lake Washington School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2015 - 2021
communications.communication:
VIA EMAIL 08/11/2022
TO: Dr. Jon Holmen

Dr. Homen, 

Thank you for your answer to my questions. Mr. Effertz was effusing to respond.  I now understand that your district/agency either has no idea what it's obligations are under the public records act, or you just don’t care.

Providing "fullest assistance" and simple answers to public records requestor questions and inquiries is, for your agency, not “optional.”

Therefore, because it is in the best interest of the public, I will go another route.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST - AUGUST 11 2022 - TO: LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT:

Provide all "records and writings" including COMMUNICATIONS regarding the following subject matter (in quotes):

"4th REQUEST FOR THE SAME ANSWERS T OTHE SAME QUESTIONS:

08/10/2022
08/08/2022
08/03/2022
07/22/2022
Subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Lake Washington School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2015 - 2021

Mr. Effertz,

You provide no evidence whatsoever to support that your statements are true.

1. What search has been done for any records responsive to this public records request dated 11-3-2021?
2. What specific locations and databases has the District searched for responsive records?
3. What specific affirmative action has the District taken to comply with the public records act in the production of records responsive to this request since 11-3-2021?
4. What specific public records requests are "in line" prior to this 11-3-2021 request that are being processed by the District?"


DEFINITION OF PUBLIC RECORD

"Public record" includes "any writing containing information relating to the conduct of government or the performance of any governmental or proprietary function prepared, owned, used, or retained by any state, county, or local agency regardless of physical form or characteristics." RCW 42.56.010(2).

WRITING

'"Writing' means handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostatting, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated." RCW 42.56.010(3).

This request specifically includes - and you are specifically directed to obtain, preserve in native format, and produce - any records that exist on any computers, hard drives, portable phones, jump drives, BlackBerries, iPhone, Kindle, IPad, or other devices, or in email, data, voice mail, or text mail accounts owned, controlled or paid for, directly or indirectly, by any agency or taxpayer.

For each record that the agency contends is exempt from public disclosure, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and specifically state how the specific statutory exemption applies to the record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3).

For each responsive record that you contend is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

COMMUNICATIONS

With respect to requests for records that include "communications," I am requesting all emails, text messages, and telephone records, regardless the type of device or account from which the communication was generated or where the device or data is stored (including personal devices such as personal cell phones, laptops, tablets, and/or computers etc. used from home to conduct public business during the COVID-19 Pandemic). Nissen v. Pierce County, 183 Wa.2d 863 (2015).

PRODUCTION OF RECORDS 

I request for these public records to be produced by public (no password) e-mail attachment or link. If electronic attachment or link is not possible, an alternative would be to produce responsive records via USB DRIVE or DATA CD-ROM.

I request electronic production of all records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record. 


THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING MADE FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

SEARCH FOR AND EXEMPTION OF RESPONSIVE RECORDS

Your agency’s search for responsive records should involve a good-faith search of all public employee personal devices reasonably believed to contain responsive requested records regardless the type of device or account from which the communication was generated or where the device or data is stored (including personal devices such as personal cell phones, laptops, tablets, and/or computers etc. used from home to conduct public business during the COVID-19 Pandemic). Nissen v. Pierce County, 183 Wa.2d 863 (2015).

Also, please provide a reasonably detailed, nonconclusory affidavit attesting to the nature and extent of any search of any privately owned public employee computer, device, or account.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.
These files are installment 1. I anticipate the next installment on or before September 23, 2022

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Lake Washington School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2015 - 2021
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Titchbourne ,

As you should be aware, exemptions are "narrowly construed" by law. The courts have been consistent that name, address, telephone number, and email addresses of public records requestors are NOT EXEMPT from disclosure. 
 
 1.	You have provided no exemption logs. Why are you redacting information? What exemptions are you claiming under the PRA?
 
 2. You have transformed and modified these original records requested into new records with new filenames. You have created new records which was not requested. 
 
 For instance, file "LWSD-Muckrock_000163.pdf" refers to a request including the following:
 
 "Dear Mr. Boyd:
 
 Attached please find the records responsive for your May 11, 2015 request for:
 
 Access to and a copy of all data related to concussion incidents for high school athletes at all high schools in the district but at least Lake Washington High School for sports years 2004-2014. All data with columns related to date, sport, season, age, gender, days kept out, and any records associated with district recording related to the Lystedt Law CRCW.28A.600. 190."
 
 However no responsive records are attached. Another .pdf file in the installment does refer to concussion incident reports, however as a requestor I am not obligated to assume, guess, or infer that this file which was attached to a response to Mr. Bord's request, a file which you have extracted and renamed from the originally requested PRA response if it is in fact the original attachment. 
 
 Additionally, missing  is Mr. Boyd's original public records request as well as others, however we are not given enough context to understand what is missing and what is not.

3. What records does this "installment 1" represent? You provide no context, meanwhile Lake Washington School District has already provided multiple installments of records. This is certainly not "Installment One." Please explain in detail. 

Please provide all responsive records again as requested, unredacted or with the proper exemption logs and explanations of what records are being provided, what records are being withheld, and why. 

4. We understand that now the District is for the 4th time giving a new "final"  estimated completion date for this request as 02-28-2023 (modified from the original missed final estimated completion date of 07-15-2022 Originally Provided by the District on 11-21-21).

Thank you.

communications.subject: Lake Washington School District (11/3/21 PRA Request)
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Please see the following responses to your inquiries:

1. You have provided no exemption logs. Why are you redacting information? What exemptions are you claiming under the PRA?

The District redacts all information in accordance with the exemptions authorized under the Public Records Act and corresponding case law. We will provide an exemption log for this installment by the end of the week.

2. You have transformed and modified these original records requested into new records with new filenames. You have created new records which was not requested.

The District currently processes public records through a standard e-discovery software – particularly when requests involve a substantial volume of responsive materials. In compliance with the PRA, all responsive records have been produced or will be identified in the forthcoming log.

3. What records does this "installment 1" represent? You provide no context, meanwhile Lake Washington School District has already provided multiple installments of records. This is certainly not "Installment One." Please explain in detail.

I apologize for the error in nomenclature – the District has recently experience staff turnover and my firm, as outside general counsel for the District, is helping the District provide the fullest assistance possible to requestors at this time. I will confirm in our records what has been sent out to date and correct this installment name to reflect its occurrence in the series.

Sincerely,
Lauren Titchbourne | PRK Livengood
Attorney

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request - Aaron Swartz
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act and Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552. I hereby request the following records:

All records related to Aaron Swartz or the downloading of JSTOR articles via MIT from 2009 to 2014 within your agency's possession, the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI).

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. I request that any records maintained in an electronic format be provided in that same format (such as a PDF, CSV, or XLS file), to avoid copying costs.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

If you have any questions or concerns, or if I can provide any clarification that so as to focus, clarify, or narrow this request, please do not hesitate to contact me

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statue requires.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being

title: FOIA - Evanston Illinois PD - Flock Safety Documents 2023

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA - Evanston Illinois PD - Flock Safety Documents 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to Flock Safety (https://www.flocksafety.com) license-plate-reader hardware and/or software. Documents being requested here should include - but are not limited to - the following:

- Invoices, receipts, and/or requests for the purchase of any Flock Safety product/service
- MOUs with Flock Safety
- Brochures or product/service specifications regarding Flock Safety
- Privacy and/or retention policies regarding Flock Safety product/services
- Manuals regarding Flock Safety product/services
- Briefings & presentations mentioning Flock Safety product/services
- Locations of Flock camera installations throughout Evanston
- All emails sent to, or received from, (including To, Cc, Bcc fields) email addresses containing "@cityofevanston.org" between January 1, 2023 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates) that mention "flock safety" and/or "ALPR"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Northwestside Coalition

communications.subject: [External Message Added] City of Evanston public records request #23-1919
[External Message Added] City of Evanston public records request #23-1919
communications.communication:
City of Evanston ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #23-1919: You are hereby notified that your Request for public records has been determined to be unduly burdensome pursuant to Section 3(g) of FOIA. The extraordinary volume of documents (estimated to be over 7000 pages and estimated 30 staff hours and multiple staff members to fill) the request is too burdensome on City resources to produce the request as drafted. Please contact the Clerk's Office at 847-448-8189 to discuss narrowing the scope of the request. Please consider narrowing your request by sender/recipient, topic or date. If you agree to narrow your request, you must submit a revised written request. The City of Evanston will take no further action or send you any further correspondence unless and until your current request is narrowed in writing. If we do not receive your narrowed request within fourteen (14) calendar days of the date of this letter, your current request will be denied. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of Evanston.
Technical support: See our help page

title: Child care licensing records 2019-present (Department of Health and Human Services)

communications.subject: New Hampshire Right to Know Law Request: Child care licensing records 2019-present (Department of Health and Human Services)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Hampshire Right to Know Law, I hereby request the following records:

Historical licensing data for all licensed child care providers (active and closed) that were open anytime from 1/1/19-present:
•	Provider name or ID
•	Provider address
•	Latest license issue date and expiration date 
•	First license issue date
•	Any additional provider data that your agency collects

If electronic records from before 1/1/19 are available, I’d be happy to collect them as well.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

communications.subject: RE: New Hampshire Right to Know Law Request: Child care licensing records 2019-present (Department of Health and Human Services)

communications.subject: Right to Know Request
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Gabrielle.  I am in receipt of your Right to Know request pursuant to which you are seeking information regarding licensed child care providers.  Today I spoke with the Unit Chief for the Child Care Licensing Unit.  She is unsure at this point if she can run a query that will capture all of the information that you have requested.  It is possible that she may need the assistance of the Department of Information Technology to access some of the information you would like.  For this reason, we do not know at this point how long it will take to provide the requested information.  I should have a better sense of that by the end of the week.  On or before the end of the day on Friday August 18, 2023 I will reach out to you with an update.



John B. Martin, Deputy Chief Legal Counsel

communications.subject: Right to Know Request
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Gabrielle.  I am responding to your Right to Know request relative to licensed child care programs in New Hampshire.

I've attached a list of closed programs since 2019.  The list of programs currently operating is also attached with the information requested.  Please note that we do not have the first license issue date for all programs.  Some have been licensed for a long time and their initial license was issued prior to the implementation of the current database utilized by the Child Care Licensing Unit.

Available public information can be found as follows:

Inspection information:
https://forms.nh.gov/licenseverification/Search.aspx?facility=

Choose Child Care under Profession. The programs listed online are all programs currently licensed, and includes visit history for the previous 3 years.

Some inspections from July 2023 on are on the website below, as we are transitioning to a new database.

https://new-hampshire.my.site.com/nhccis/NH_ChildCareSearch

Have a great weekend.


John B. Martin, Deputy Chief Legal Counsel

communications.subject: CPSC FOIA Request # 21-F-00500
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, Ms. Crose,

We have received your Freedom of Information Act request.  So we can begin processing, please confirm for us what your requester category is - i.e., whether you are a commercial requester, news media, or individual.

Note:  There are three categories of requesters: 1) Commercial; 2) educational institutions, noncommercial scientific institutions, and representatives of the news media; and 3) all other requesters, including members of the general public.  The requester category bears on the amount of fees that might be assessed in processing your request.

Definitions of each requester category, and information on what fees (i.e., for search, review, and duplication) would be charged depending on the requester category can be found in our revised fee regulations found here:  https://www.ecfr.gov/cgi-bin/text-idx?SID=f97c375521e692fad78c1a5f62893518&mc=true&node=se16.2.1015_19&rgn=div8

Please reply directly to me via email confirming your requester category, and provide sufficient information supporting your identification of the applicable requester category.  We will then be able to assign your request for processing.

Thank you,


Robert J. Dalton
Senior Attorney Advisor
U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission
4330 East West Highway
Bethesda, MD 20814
301-504-7246
rdalton@cpsc.gov<mailto:rdalton@cpsc.gov>

communications.subject: CPSC FOIA 21-F-00500 - Status Inquiry
communications.communication:
Dear Requester, 

Thank you for your June 5, 2023, status inquiry regarding FOIA request 21-F-00500. The records custodian informed me that your request is still too broad and overly burdensome because it would take them a year of exclusively working on your request to retrieve all of the responsive records. Please further narrow the search time frame, and provide name(s) of particular social media account(s) by COB June 9, 2023. Thank you. 

Regards, 
Abi Oyewole 
aoyewole@cpsc.gov 
*****!!!
Unless otherwise stated, any views or opinions expressed in this
e-mail (and any attachments) are solely those of the author and do
not necessarily represent those of the U.S. Consumer Product Safety
Commission.

Copies of product recall and product safety information can be sent
to you automatically via Internet e-mail, as they are released by
CPSC. To subscribe or unsubscribe to this service go to the following
web page: http://www.cpsc.gov/en/Newsroom/Subscribe

communications.communication:

Thank you for your prompt reply. Yes, the smaller search time frame makes it much more reasonable. The records custodian said he can complete that search within 2 -3 weeks.


Regards,
Abi
______________________


Abioye Oyewole

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Thank You Spa (Austin Mayor's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Records relating to "Thank You Spa", a health spa located at 1916 Fort View Rd, Austin, TX 78704, since January 1, 2020.
2) Records records pertaining to the address 1916 Fort View Rd, Austin, TX 78704 since January 1, 2020.

To minimize the scope of the search, please limit to:
1) Correspondence records pertaining to the above
2) Complaint or investigation records pertaining to the above

It's possible that this business will appear in documents pertaining to sex trafficking.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lewis Manning

Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(x ) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x ) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body;

Sincerely,

Chicago Public Schools

August 18, 2023 Miriam Bhimani 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N013990-073023 
Dear Miriam Bhimani: This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking the following information: 
1. Provide a list or records of all severance agreements including severance amounts and agreement dates from March 1, 2023 through June 30, 2023. 
2. Provide a list or records of all settlements including settlement amounts and settlement dates from March 1, 2023 through June 30, 2023. RESPONSE : Documents responsive to your request concerning settlements less than $50k are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Under the rules of FOIA, student names and parent names have been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5(r) which exempts personally identifiable student information in accordance with the Illinois School Student Records Act 105 ILCS 10/1 et seq. To locate documents responsive to your request concerning settlements more than $50k can be found on the Chicago Board of Education website, under past meeting actions: https://www.cpsboe.org/meetings/past-meetings . Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/8.5: Records maintained online. (a) Notwithstanding any provision of this Act, to the contrary, a public body is not required to copy a public record that is published on the public body’s website. The public body shall notify the requester that the public record is available online and direct the requester to the website where the record can be reasonably accessed. To the extent you consider this a denial, pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) you may file a Request for Review with the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at: Public Access Counselor; Office of the Attorney General; 500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, IL 62706.  You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court; 5 ILCS 140/11. Thank you for your request. Sincerely, Ana Diaz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
August 18, 2023 Miriam Bhimani 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N013991-073023 
Dear Miriam Bhimani: This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking the following information: 
Records sufficient to show the settlement agreements of the following: 
1. John Doe, settled July 15, 2022 
2. Julie Doe, settled July 27, 2022 
3. Jane Doe, parent of a minor, settled August 29, 2022 
4. AC and RC, guardians of a student, settled September 1, 2022 
5. Student by CE and AM parents, settled October 24, 2022 
6. A student by DG, parent, settled October 11, 2022 
7. A student by AB, parent and GC, guardian, settled on December 1, 2022 
8. Roman, Lucila settled on February 3, 2023 
9. Student by FK and DB, parents settled on March 20, 2023 
10. Student by RK, parent, settled on March 23, 2023 RESPONSE : Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Under the rules of FOIA, private information and unique identifiers contained within public records are exempt from disclosure; those portions have been redacted including, private phone numbers, private home address, and other private information. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(b), “Private information, unless disclosure is required by another provision of this Act, a State or federal law or a court order,” and pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c), “Personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subjects of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs the legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. The disclosure of information that bears on the public duties of public employees and officials shall not be considered an invasion of personal privacy. Portions of the information have been redacted to protect identifiable student information included within the records. Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5(r) in accordance with Illinois Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at its direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored. 105 ILCS 10/(d): Release of a minor’s record may only be authorized by the parent or guardian in accordance with the Illinois student Records Act (105 ILCS 10/1 et seq.). To the extent you consider this a denial, pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) you may file a Request for Review with the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at: Public Access Counselor; Office of the Attorney General; 500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, IL 62706.  You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court; 5 ILCS 140/11. Thank you for your request. Sincerely, Ana Diaz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

-Any communication (emails, text messages) sent or received by Chancellor John Sharp concerning Joy Alonzo, the investigation into her public remarks about Lt. Gov Dan Patrick, the subsequent investigation into her, or the fallout from that investigation being disclosed publicly

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wesley Lowery

08/18/2023 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of July 27, 2023, Reference # H001972-072723 
Dear Wesley Lowery, 
Texas A&M University received a public information request from you on July 27, 2023.  Your request mentioned: 
"To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 

-A copy of the employee HR file for Joy Alonzo, including any complaints, investigations or disciplinary actions filed against her 
-Any communication (emails, text messages) sent or received by Chancellor John Sharp concerning Joy Alonzo, the investigation into her public remarks about Lt. Gov Dan Patrick, the subsequent investigation into her, or the fallout from that investigation being disclosed publicly 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Wesley Lowery" 
The information found responsive to the first item of your request is available and can be obtained by visiting the and logging in from the “My Request Center” tab. Per your affirmative response to the "Redaction Statement" giving us permission to redact information subject to mandatory and discretionary exceptions, we have redacted and/or withheld information excepted under the following sections of the Texas Government Code: 552.024 (Electing to Disclose Address and Telephone Number) and 552.137 (Confidentiality of Certain Email Addresses). Public Records Online Portal 
Additionally, some of the information requested was the subject of an open records request previously received by our office. We requested a decision letter from the Office of the Attorney General (OAG) to withhold some of the information and they ruled in our favor. We are still relying on the attached ruling letter and have withheld information in accordance with the OAG's previously issued letter. Finally, in regards to the second item of your request, records that would be in the possession of Chancellor John Sharp are not maintained by the university. This portion of your request will need to be directed to the System Offices of The Texas A&M University System. Please submit your open records request to the System Offices on the following web page: http://www.tamus.edu/legal/open-records/open-records-request/ or by email to  openrecords@tamus.edu. (mailto:openrecords@tamus.edu) 
Sincerely, 
Knesha Brashear Open Records Office

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to obtain the last 200 pages of emails sent to, from, or copied to Samantha Power.

You may start with the most recent email (as of the time you receive this request). Convert this email to PDF and then proceed to the immediately prior email until 200 pages of emails have been produced.

I request that you ignore spam, junk mail, or newsletters.

As a member of the news media publishing in outlets like The Intercept, The New Republic, and The Nation I ask that any fees be waved.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daniel Boguslaw

communications.subject: USAID FOIA No. F-00189-21 (Acknowledgment Letter)
communications.communication:
June 03, 2021 RE:  USAID FOIA No. F-00189-21 (Acknowledgment Letter) Dear Mr. Boguslaw: Thank you for your letter dated June 02, 2021, requesting information pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. §  552.  The tracking number for your request is F-00189-21.  Please use this number when corresponding with our office. At this time, we are in the process of perfecting your request.  A perfected request for records reasonably describes such records and is made in accordance with published rules stating the time, place, fees (if any) and procedures to be followed.  This process includes reviewing the request for clarity and fee category determination and related commitment to pay, if applicable. Once your request is perfected, you will be notified of the FOIA Specialist assigned to process your case.  If you have questions, please contact us at .  Please cite the above-referenced number when corresponding with our office. (mailto:foia@usaid.gov) foia@usaid.gov Thank you. Sincerely, Diamond Johnson 
FOIA Specialist 
Bureau for Management 
Office of Management Services 
Information and Records Division

communications.subject: USAID FOIA REQUEST No. F-00189-21 (FOIA Specialist Assignment Email)
communications.communication:
June 03, 2021 RE:  USAID FOIA No. F-00189-21 (FOIA Specialist Assignment Email) Dear Mr. Boguslaw: This acknowledges receipt of your June 02, 2021, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the United States Agency for International Development (USAID).  Specifically, you requested records concerning the last 200 pages of emails sent to, from, or copied to Samantha Power. You also requested a fee waiver. 
Fee Waiver 
The FOIA provides that fees should be waived or reduced if disclosure of the information is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations and activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester.  As a member of the media, the only applicable fee is duplication.  Duplication is $0.10 per page, but the first 100 pages are free.  After review of the fee waiver criteria, your fee waiver request is moot.  Since the only applicable fee is duplication, and USAID routinely furnishes responsive records to FOIA requesters in electronic format, it's most likely there will be no duplication fees to assess. 
FOIA Specialist 
Your request has been assigned to Theresa Morris, Senior FOIA Specialist.  You may contact Theresa Morris by email at thmorris@usaid.gov or by phone on 202-921-5003.  Please reference the tracking number cited above in any future correspondence. 
Extending the FOIA’s Time Limits due to Unusual Circumstances The FOIA provides that an agency  may extend its time limits when “unusual circumstances” occur in the processing of a request. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B)(i) (2016).  Those “unusual circumstances” are set forth in the statute, 5 U.S.C § 552(a)(6)(B)(iii), and are described as: 1) The need to search for records from field facilities or other locations separate from the office processing the request; 2) The need to search, collect and examine voluminous records; and 3) The need for consultation with another agency. Based upon the records you have requested, we have determined that one or more unusual circumstances will occur during the processing of your request.  Accordingly, your response time-limit has been extended beyond the 20 days required by statute; therefore, 10 additional processing days have been added to your request. To mitigate this action, you may limit the scope of the request so that it can be processed more quickly or to arrange an alternative time to respond. If you have any questions or wish to discuss reformulation or an alternative time frame for the processing of your request, you may contact the assigned FOIA Specialist noted above. You may also contact USAID’s FOIA Public Liaison, Christopher Colbow, at foia@usaid.gov. 

Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services offered: Office of Government Information Services National Archives and Records Administration 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001 E-mail: ogis@nara.gov Telephone: 202-741-5770; Toll Free: 1-877-684-6448 Fax: 202-741-5769 Thank you for your interest in USAID. Sincerely, Diamond Johnson 
FOIA Specialist 
Bureau for Management 
Office of Management Services 
Information and Records Division

communications.subject: USAID FOIA Email Receipt RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #F-00189-21
communications.communication:
Greetings - 

Thank you for contacting the USAID FOIA office. We have received your request and will respond within 48 hours. 

Kindly be informed of the following: 

Requesting records containing personally identifiable information (PII): 
1st Party Request: 
If you are requesting records about yourself, we must verify your identity prior to initiating a search for records. Please complete and return t he AID form 507-1, Certification of Identity, located here: https://www.usaid.gov/forms/aid-507-1. Please submit the completed form in addition to the source documents outlined in section 2 encrypted via (https://www.usaid.gov/forms/aid-507-1) foia@usaid.gov, accompanied by a password in a separate email. (mailto:foia@usaid.gov) 
3rd Party Request: 
If you are requesting records concerning another individual on their behalf, you must provide a statement from that individual verifying their identity. Please have the subject of the request complete sections 1 and 2 of the AID form 507-1, Certification of Identity, located here: https://www.usaid.gov/forms/aid-507-1. As the 3rd party requester, please complete section 3. Send the completed form and source documents outlined in section 2 encrypted via (https://www.usaid.gov/forms/aid-507-1) foia@usaid.gov, accompanied by a password, prior initiating a search for records. (mailto:foia@usaid.gov) 
Requesting acquisition (contracts, etc.) and assistance (grants, cooperative agreements, etc.) awards: 

We receive many requests for procurement documents: solicitations, proposals, and contracts. Sometimes our requesters only provide us with the solicitation number. If possible, when you are requesting winning proposals, please provide the following additional information: the office that issued the solicitation, the title of the solicitation, the name of the successful bidder, and the number of the resulting award. For procurement documents, please provide the award number, office that issued the award, program name, and geographic location. 

Thank you, 

USAID FOIA Team 

-- 
V/r, FOIA Specialist US AID - US Agency for International Development FOIA Office Bureau for Management, Office of Management Services, Information and Records Division (M/MS/IRD) | foia@USAID.gov

communications.subject: USAID FOIA Email Receipt RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #F-00189-21
communications.communication:
Greetings - 

Thank you for contacting the USAID FOIA office. We have received your request and will respond within 48 hours. 

Kindly be informed of the following: 

Requesting records containing personally identifiable information (PII): 
1st Party Request: 
If you are requesting records about yourself, we must verify your identity prior to initiating a search for records. Please complete and return t he AID form 507-1, Certification of Identity, located here: https://www.usaid.gov/forms/aid-507-1. Please submit the completed form in addition to the source documents outlined in section 2 encrypted via (https://www.usaid.gov/forms/aid-507-1) foia@usaid.gov, accompanied by a password in a separate email. (mailto:foia@usaid.gov) 
3rd Party Request: 
If you are requesting records concerning another individual on their behalf, you must provide a statement from that individual verifying their identity. Please have the subject of the request complete sections 1 and 2 of the AID form 507-1, Certification of Identity, located here: https://www.usaid.gov/forms/aid-507-1. As the 3rd party requester, please complete section 3. Send the completed form and source documents outlined in section 2 encrypted via (https://www.usaid.gov/forms/aid-507-1) foia@usaid.gov, accompanied by a password, prior initiating a search for records. (mailto:foia@usaid.gov) 
Requesting acquisition (contracts, etc.) and assistance (grants, cooperative agreements, etc.) awards: 

We receive many requests for procurement documents: solicitations, proposals, and contracts. Sometimes our requesters only provide us with the solicitation number. If possible, when you are requesting winning proposals, please provide the following additional information: the office that issued the solicitation, the title of the solicitation, the name of the successful bidder, and the number of the resulting award. For procurement documents, please provide the award number, office that issued the award, program name, and geographic location. 

Thank you, 

USAID FOIA Team 

-- 
V/r, FOIA Specialist US AID - US Agency for International Development FOIA Office Bureau for Management, Office of Management Services, Information and Records Division (M/MS/IRD) | foia@USAID.gov

communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting SecureRelease Support.

The purpose of this inbox is to provide technical and user access support for the SecureRelease FOIA Request Portal website (https://www.securerelease.us/).
SecureRelease Support is not involved with the processing or prioritization of requests, and this inbox is not monitored by agency personnel.

According to our records, request 2023-HQFO-01234 was not submitted through the SecureRelease Request Portal or through our integration with FOIA.gov, and we do not show a SecureRelease account registered to 113171-01353742@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:113171-01353742@requests.muckrock.com>. Therefore, 2023-HQFO-01234 is not available in the SecureRelease portal. To inquire with the agency regarding this request, please use the contact information provided in their March 20 email.

If you wish to register a new SecureRelease account for 113171-01353742@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:113171-01353742@requests.muckrock.com>, please visit https://www.securerelease.us/account-page/sign-in/ and click the Create Account button. Creating a SecureRelease account will give the agency the option to send communications and records to you via the portal in response to your request.

Best,

SecureRelease™ Support Team

Re:  2023-HQFO-01234

Dear Daniel Boguslaw:

This is the [electronic] final response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), dated 6/2/2021, and received by this office on 2/7/2023.  You are seeking the last 200 pages of emails sent to, from, or copied to Samantha Power.

OR

This is the final response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the [Request|ConsultReferral From (Agency){Agency}|Name], dated 6/2/2021, and seeking the last 200 pages of emails sent to, from, or copied to Samantha Power.  While processing your request, the [Request|ConsultReferral From (Agency){Agency}|Name] located records that fall under the purview of the Department of Homeland Security (DHS).  Accordingly, your request and [Request|No. of Pages Referred] pages of responsive records were referred to this office for processing and direct response to you.  This office received your request on 2/7/2023.  

If it is a Privacy Act request add… 

To provide you with the greatest degree of access authorized by law, we have considered your request under both FOIA, 5 U.S.C. § 552, and the Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a.  Information about an individual that is maintained in a Privacy Act system of records may be accessed by that individual  unless the agency has exempted the system of records from the access provisions of the Privacy Act.   However, I determined that none of the withheld information is maintained in a system of records that is retrievable by your name or other personal identifier.  Therefore, the information you requested was processed under FOIA.

OR

To provide you with the greatest degree of access authorized by law, we have considered your request under both FOIA, 5 U.S.C. § 552, and the Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a. Information about an individual that is maintained in a Privacy Act system of records may be accessed by that individual  unless the agency has exempted the system of records from the access provisions of the Privacy Act.   [IF PRIVACY ACT INVOLVED, NEED TO IDENTIFY THE SYSTEM OF RECORDS AND ANY APPLICABLE EXEMPTIONS]  [SEE PRIVACY ACT EXEMPTION TEMPLATE]

OPTION 1:  USE IF NO DISCRETIONARY RELEASE IS MADE - DELETE PORTIONS NOT NEEDED:

A search of [NAMES OFFICES SEARCHED] for documents responsive to your request produced a total of [XXX] pages. I have considered the foreseeable harm standard when reviewing the record set and have applied the FOIA exemptions as required by the statute and the Attorney General’s guidance.  Of those pages, I have determined that [XXX] pages of the records are releasable in their entirety, [XXX] pages are partially releasable, and [XXX] pages are withheld in their entirety pursuant to Title 5 U.S.C. § 552 [ENTER APPROPRIATE EXEMPTION CODE: (b)(1), (b)(2), (b)(3), (b)(4), (b)(5), (b)(6), (b)(7)(A), (b)(7)(B), (b)(7)(C), (b)(7)(D), (b)(7)(E) and (b)(7)(F), FOIA Exemptions 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, b7(A), b7(B),b7(C), b7(D), b7(E), and b7(F)]. 

Enclosed are [XXX] pages with certain information withheld as described below:

OPTION 2:  USE IF EXEMPTIONS COULD BE ASSERTED BUT YOU HAVE DISCRETIONARILY OPTED TO RELEASE IN PART ( DISCRETIONARY DISCLOSURE) - DELETE PORTIONS NOT NEEDED:

A search of [NAMES OFFICES SEARCHED] for documents responsive to your request produced a total of [XXX] pages. I have considered the foreseeable harm standard when reviewing the record set and have applied the FOIA exemptions as required by the statute and the Attorney General’s guidance.   As a result of discussion between agency personnel [OR LIST COMPONENT] and a member of my staff, as a matter of administrative discretion, I am releasing [DESCRIBE DOCUMENTS]. I have determined that [XXX] pages of the records are releasable in their entirety, [XXX] pages are partially releasable, and [XXX] pages are withheld in their entirety pursuant to Title 5 U.S.C. § 552 [ENTER APPROPRIATE EXEMPTION CODE: (b)(1), (b)(2) (b)(3), (b)(4), (b)(5), (b)(6), (b)(7)(A), (b)(7)(B), (b)(7)(C), (b)(7)(D), (b)(7)(E), and (b)(7)(F), FOIA Exemptions 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, b7(A), b7(B),b7(C), b7(D), b7(E), and b7(F)].

Enclosed are [#] pages with certain information withheld as described below.  [ENTER EXEMPTION PARAGRAPHS, AS APPROPRIATE.]  [SEE FOIA EXEMPTION TEMPLATE.]

OR

[SPELL OUT NUMBER ] pages are withheld in full as described below.  [SEE FOIA EXEMPTION TEMPLATE.]

You have a right to appeal the above withholding determination.  Should you wish to do so, you must send your appeal and a copy of this letter, within 90 days of the date of this letter, to:  Privacy Office, Attn: FOIA Appeals, U.S. Department of Homeland Security, 2707 Martin Luther King Jr. Avenue, SE, Mail Stop 0655, Washington, D.C. 20528-0655, following the procedures outlined in the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(e)(2).  Your envelope and letter should be marked “FOIA Appeal.”  Copies of the FOIA and DHS FOIA regulations are available at www.dhs.gov/foia.

NO FEES
Provisions of FOIA [AND THE PRIVACY ACT] allow DHS to charge for processing fees, up to $25, unless you seek a waiver of fees.  In this instance, because the cost is below the $25 minimum, there is no charge.  

OR IF FEES ARE ASSESSED

Provisions of FOIA [AND THE PRIVACY ACT] allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request. Pursuant to the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.11, please forward a check or money order for $[XXX.XX] within 30 days from the date of this letter, payable to the Treasury of the United States.  You should mail your check to:

                         Privacy Office, Mail Stop 0655
                         Department of Homeland Security
                         2707 Martin Luther King Jr. AVE SE
                         Washington, DC 20528-065

In order to be sure your account is credited, you must reference the DHS FOIA Number 2023-HQFO-01234 on your check or money order and attach it to a copy of this letter.  The Department may institute collection action pursuant to Federal debt collection statutes, which provide for recovery of interest, administrative charges, and penalty charges for handling a delinquent debt owed to the government.

You may contact the DHS FOIA Public Liaison at 202-343-1743 for any further assistance and to discuss any aspect of your request.  You may also contact OGIS at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.

If you need to contact our office again about this matter, please refer to 2023-HQFO-01234.  This office can be reached at FOIA@HQ.DHS.GOV or call 202-343-1743 or toll free 1-866-431-0486.

title: Blissway - Colorado Transportation Investment Office (CTIO) / High Performance Transportation Enterprise  (HPTE)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Blissway - Colorado Transportation Investment Office (CTIO) / High Performance Transportation Enterprise  (HPTE)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all contracts (as well as all associated amendments, exhibits, and materials), memorandums of understanding, and other equivalent agreements entered into by any of the following agencies/departments: Colorado Department of Transportation,  Colorado Transportation Investment Office , and/or Colorado High Performance Transportation Enterprise with Blissway.

Any and all feedback (As mentioned on page 3/10 of the agreement section or page 9/19 of the attached document "5-board-memo-blissway-map-memo-agreement-resoultion.pdf", section 7: Feedback ) provided to Blissway from the aforementioned agencies.

Any and all results/reports related to system performance validation and comparative analysis against the existing express toll lane system to prove vehicle capture and trip formation. To include but not be limited to the following systems: Vehicle detection, Vehicle identification, Trip building, Rate assignment, System availability, Identification of improper vehicles, Real-time traffic data, and Sending fully formed transactions to CSC.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Advocate

communications.communication:
Dear Kate,

Thank you for contacting us regarding OSTP FOIA # 23-003. Pursuant to regulation, OSTP uses a multitrack processing system when reviewing FOIA requests. Requests within each track are processed on a "first-in, first-out" basis (32 C.F.R. § 2402.6(e)(1)). OSTP is currently processing the requests that were received prior to the instant one. Thus, the anticipated completion time frame is within a 1 to 2 months, but that is subject to change as the processing progresses.
Regards,

OSTP FOIA

I wanted to follow up on the following DC Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Oct. 11, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #23-003.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: DC Freedom of Information Act Request #23-003
communications.communication:
Dear Kate:

Per our January 3, 2023 correspondence, the estimated processing time for this request is 1 to 2 months. OSTP is currently processing the requests that were received before the instant one. We are working diligently to process all pending requests and will provide updates as they become available.

Thank you in advance for your cooperation.
Best Regards,

OSTP FOIA

communications.subject: RE: DC Freedom of Information Act Request #23-003
communications.communication:
Dear OSTP FOIA team,

Regarding your 4/24/23 communication asking for confirmation of receipt of four files totaling 435 pages, it appears I did not receive 435 pages worth of files. I was given 4 files, a production letter of 4 pages and 3 document collections (2023.4.7_RELEASE_23-003_A_RELEASE_Interim_Prod_1_pages_1-100, 101-200 and 201-300) each totaling 100 pages. I seem to be missing 131 pages.

Can you please provide the additional documents?

thank you,
Kate Kaye

On Oct. 10, 2022:
Subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: bill of rights (Office Of Science And Technology Policy, The White House)
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All communications including email and print communications between Office of Science and Technology Policy staff and staff of the Federal Trade Commission, Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, Equal Employment Opportunity Commission and the The National Telecommunications and Information Administration regarding the "AI Bill of Rights" and the "Blueprint for an AI Bill of Rights" from January 1, 2022 through October 10, 2022
- All communications including email and print communications between OSTP staff and Justin Lynch between October 1, 2021 and October 10, 2022

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kate Kaye

On Oct. 10, 2022:
Subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: bill of rights (Office Of Science And Technology Policy, The White House)
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All communications including email and print communications between Office of Science and Technology Policy staff and staff of the Federal Trade Commission, Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, Equal Employment Opportunity Commission and the The National Telecommunications and Information Administration regarding the "AI Bill of Rights" and the "Blueprint for an AI Bill of Rights" from January 1, 2022 through October 10, 2022
- All communications including email and print communications between OSTP staff and Justin Lynch between October 1, 2021 and October 10, 2022

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kate Kaye

On Oct. 10, 2022:
Subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: bill of rights (Office Of Science And Technology Policy, The White House)
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All communications including email and print communications between Office of Science and Technology Policy staff and staff of the Federal Trade Commission, Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, Equal Employment Opportunity Commission and the The National Telecommunications and Information Administration regarding the "AI Bill of Rights" and the "Blueprint for an AI Bill of Rights" from January 1, 2022 through October 10, 2022
- All communications including email and print communications between OSTP staff and Justin Lynch between October 1, 2021 and October 10, 2022

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kate Kaye
