communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Oregon Animal Mutilations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request any and all files in connection with animal or livestock mutilations from 1967 through 2022. I believe these records are under the purview of the Oregon State Police (OSP).

As a citizen of the United States, I am entitled to access public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552. I request that you provide me with copies of all records, documents, notes, reports, and any other material related to animal or livestock mutilations that have been investigated by the Oregon State Police (OSP) from January 1, 1967, to December 31, 2022.

Please provide me with any available information regarding the following:

The number of reported animal or livestock mutilations in Oregon from 1967 to 2022.
The locations of the reported animal or livestock mutilations.
The number of investigations launched into these incidents.
The results of the investigations, including any reports, conclusions, or findings.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Nathan Isaac

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Roster and hire dates
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A roster of current law enforcement officers at this agency, with full names and hire dates. Please provide these records in their current format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Josh Chamberlain.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: ManTech
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to or mentioning ManTech, ManTech International, or ManTech International Corporation, including but not limited to records relating to their being hacked by Anonymous.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to obtain all emails sent to, from, or copied to tipoutreach@state.gov from September 25, 2019 to September 27, 2019 containing any of the following non-case-sensitive key-strings: "DOLE to clarify".

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Taylor Amarel

title: Public Records Request - AdventHealth or Adventist Health System

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - AdventHealth or Adventist Health System
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, s. 286.011, F.S., I hereby request the following records:

All court documents within the jurisdiction of the court wherein AdventHealth aka Adventist Health System aka Adventist Health System Sunbelt Healthcare Corporation d/b/a AdventHealth (Healthcare Corporation) is listed as either plaintiff or defendant in a civil lawsuit from 2016 to 2023, on the day this request is processed.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I would also appreciate an approximate time frame for this request to be processed. Depending of the time frame for the request to be fulfilled and any fees that may be incurred, I may revise the criteria.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request - Premier, Inc. (Federal Trade Commission)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act and Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552. I hereby request the following records:

All records related to Premier, Inc. from from 2013 to 2023 (present day) within your agency's possession.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statue requires.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

communications.subject: Thank you
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you for submitting your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Federal Trade Commission (FTC). Someone from our office will reach out to you as soon as possible regarding the status of your request.

Sincerely,

The FTC FOIA Unit

communications.subject: #FOIA-2023-01424 HOLD Letter and Request for Clarification
communications.communication:
Dear Requester:



This correspondence acknowledges the receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated July 18, 2023 seeking all records relating to Premier Inc. between 2013 and 2023. This request has been temporarily placed on hold.



As written, the request is too broad and would be unduly burdensome on the agency to process. "[A]n agency need not respond to a request that is so broad as to impose an unreasonable burden upon the agency, such as one which requires the agency to locate, review, redact, and arrange for inspection a vast quantity of material." See Serv. Women's Action Network v. Dep't of Def., 888 F. Supp. 2d 282, 290 (D. Conn. 2012) (internal quotation marks omitted); see also Halpern v. F.B.I., 181 F.3d 279, 288 (2d Cir. 1999) ("[A]n agency need not conduct a search that plainly is unduly burdensome.").



We invite you to narrow the scope of your FOIA request. To avoid the closing of your FOIA request, we ask that you please respond to this message within 10 days. Please note, the closing of your request will not prohibit you from submitting requests in the future.



If you would like to schedule a meeting to discuss, please respond to this message when proposed date and times for next week. In any call or future correspondence concerning the request, please refer to the following case number #FOIA-2023-01424.
--
Lindsay A. Robinson (she/her)
General Attorney
Federal Trade Commission
Office of the General Counsel, FOIA
600 Pennsylvania Ave. NW, Washington, DC 20580
(202) 326-3401 | lrobinson@ftc.gov<mailto:lrobinson@ftc.gov>

[pic]

files.title: image001
files.source: Federal Trade Commission, United States of America

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request - Premier, Inc. (Federal Trade Commission)
communications.communication:
Hi there,

I revise narrow my timeframe to 2020 to 2023, to the day of the processing of this request. Please let me know if this still overly burdensome or produces too many results.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

communications.subject: Re: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request - Premier, Inc. (Federal Trade Commission)
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thanks for your response. The request is still too broad as it seeks all records “relating to.” The FOIA requires more specificity from the requester on the records they seek. The date range is helpful but it does not allow the FOIA Unit to target its search. Again, if you would like to discuss further, I’d be happy to schedule a meeting with you.

Lindsay A. Robinson (she/her)
General Attorney
Office of General Counsel, FOIA
Federal Trade Commission
600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW
Washington, DC 20580
(202) 390-4516 | lrobinson@ftc.gov

[X]

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #FOIA-2023-01424
communications.communication:
One aspect I am highly interested in is:

1. All records related to Premier, Inc and their transactions or contracts with AdventHealth (also known as Adventist Health System or Adventist Health System/Sunbelt Healthcare Co. d/b/a AdventHealth) within your agency's possession with the revised timeframe I specified applied thereto.

See here: https://www.adventhealth.com/services/adventhealth-business-services/suppliers

In the link above, AdventHealth, on their official website acknowledges dealings with Premier, Inc. The problem with that is that the AdventHealth CEO/President is Terry D Shaw and he is also the Board Chair of Premier, Inc. so there are obvious defects there, to say the least.

Please still enumerate the categories of records I may request from the FTC.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #FOIA-2023-01424
communications.communication:
Hello,

Your request can be updated to the description you provided below. The agency is not required under the FOIA to share what records the FTC might have, since the requester is responsible for providing a description sufficient enough for the agency to conduct its search. I can move forward with processing based on what you provided below.
--
Lindsay A. Robinson (she/her)
General Attorney
Federal Trade Commission
Office of the General Counsel, FOIA
600 Pennsylvania Ave. NW, Washington, DC 20580
(202) 326-3401 | lrobinson@ftc.gov<mailto:lrobinson@ftc.gov>

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #FOIA-2023-01424
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

To preface, I will restate the initial message but with the revised timeframe and specificity regarding records I seek within your agency's possession:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act and Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552. I hereby request the following records:

All records related to Premier, Inc. from from 2020 to 2023, to the day of the processing of this request within your agency's possession.

In terms of criteria:
1. Agency: FTC
2. Scope: Premier, Inc.
3. Timeframe: 2020  to 2023, to the day of the processing of this request within your agency's possession.
4. Description: All related related to:
a. Public documents related to FTC enforcement actions involving the company.
b. Records of adjudicative proceedings where the company was involved.
c. FTC advisory opinions and policy statements concerning business practices in the company's industry.
d. Orders to file special reports under Section 6(b) of the FTC Act.
e. Public hearing transcripts and public comments related to the company.
f. Staff manuals and instructions that may outline procedures for handling cases involving the company or its industry.
g. Non-confidential portions of consumer complaints involving the company.
h. Non-confidential reports or studies involving the company.

In summation, I request all records with respect to the criteria, meaning with the scope, timeframe, and description applied thereto.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Please let me know if this revision is satisfactory or if additional clarification is still needed.

Thank you,

Bailey Pillon

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #FOIA-2023-01424
communications.communication:
In addition:

i. Consumer complaint related to the company, Premier, Inc.

Sincerely,
Bailey Pillon

title: Child care licensing records 2019-present (Massachusetts Department Of Early Education And Care)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Child care licensing records 2019-present (Massachusetts Department Of Early Education And Care)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Historical licensing data for all licensed child care providers (active and closed) that were open anytime from 1/1/19-present:
•	Provider name or ID
•	Provider address
•	Latest license issue date and expiration date 
•	First license issue date
•	Any additional provider data that your agency collects

If electronic records from before 1/1/19 are available, I’d be happy to collect them as well.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R000573-080823
communications.communication:
Dear Gabrielle Pepin: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Massachusetts Department of Early Education and Care. Your request was received in this office on 8/7/2023 and given the reference number R000573-080823 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Requested: Massachusetts Department Of Early Education And Care
PRL Office
51 Sleeper St., 4th Floor
Boston, MA 02210

August 7, 2023

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Historical licensing data for all licensed child care providers (active and closed) that were open anytime from 1/1/19-present:
• Provider name or ID
• Provider address
• Latest license issue date and expiration date
• First license issue date
• Any additional provider data that your agency collects

If electronic records from before 1/1/19 are available, I’d be happy to collect them as well.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
Massachusetts Department of Early Education and Care

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: W2 2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Ohio Open Records Law request, copied below, and originally submitted on June 29, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Re: Ohio Open Records Law Request: W2 2022 (Tracking #23016)
communications.communication:
Dear Hal Flak,

I am writing with an update on this request. The redacting process for all
2022 form W2s is taking a considerable amount of time. If I send you a
report with the employees' name and their wage information for 2022, will
it be sufficient to meet your request? If not, are there specific employees
that I can focus on?

Thank you for your consideration,
Laura Sauber

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: W2 2022
communications.communication:
A report with the information is fine. 

Thank you.

communications.subject: Re: Ohio Open Records Law Request: W2 2022 (Tracking #23016)
communications.communication:
Dear Hal Flak,

Per your email, a report with this information instead of redacted W2 forms
has been approved and is attached. The report includes employee name and
Box 1 Federal taxable income.
Best regards,
Laura Sauber

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: David LeValley
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The personnel file of Special Agent in Charge David James LeValley (1964 - May 26, 2018). Proof of death is not required as his death was announced in a FBI press release: https://www.fbi.gov/contact-us/field-offices/atlanta/news/press-releases/fbi-atlanta-field-office-announces-the-line-of-duty-death-of-our-special-agent-in-charge-david-j-levalley

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: Washington Freedom of Information Act. Request: Washington Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Washington State University)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Washington Freedom of Information Act. Request: Washington Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Washington State University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Washington Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

title: OLYMPIA SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2020) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2020

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: OLYMPIA SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2020) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2020
communications.communication:
OLYMPIA SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2020) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2020

Via email: dcrawford@osd.wednet.edu

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1.	I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2020 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2020.

Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSCRIPTS in the year 2020 can be excluded from this request.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

 RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.
 
"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Thank you.
